item.title: Manager, Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Decision Analytics and Business Intelligence (DABI) Team is currently recruiting for an exciting role of Manager, Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with product / client partners in Personal & Commercial Banking, primarily Personal Banking & Investments and Payments teams. You will be called upon to leverage data to formulate and deliver actionable insights to support information-based business decisions and drive change. In addition, you will enable your business clients through the provisioning of data assets, analytical reports and dashboards. In this role, you will have the opportunity to build a solid understanding of RBC’s products, services and the associated client behaviors.

What will you do?

Perform comprehensive data analysis and communicate meaningful insights in the form of data sets, reports and dashboards.

Maintain or enhance existing reports to showcase insights and support tactics.

Bring in-depth data analyses to bear on the development of revolutionary client universe segmentation and value proposition.

Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries to understand business context and how it can be applied to satisfy analytics and reporting requirements. Consult with business partners to understand business goals and the intended client journey.

Seek and deliver on opportunities to automate and streamline analytics and reporting steps.

Participate in strategy meetings to gather and document business requirements and formulate analytical framework for desired outcomes.

Develop reports to detect and trace data anomalies and perform impact analysis.

Learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas within a reasonable period of time.

Participate and contribute to projects with other partner groups to meet business requirements.

Transform the way we use data by developing advanced reporting and analytics to serve our business clients.

Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

Bachelors in Mathematics / Statistics, Engineering, or Computer Science.   Masters considered an asset.

 Proficiencies in SQL, Python and similar tools to extract, manipulate and analyze large complex data. Experience with SAS, Scala, Spark, Hadoop and Unix preferred.

Advanced Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint skills.

Excellent research and analytical capabilities, data visualization skills to produce complex data analysis.

Strong consulting mindset to thoroughly understand what he / she is solving for and how their business partners will leverage the insights.

Self-starter, able to work and think through problems and assignments in a self-directed manner

Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of assignments and deadlines simultaneously; ability to prioritize.

Nice to have:

3+ years of experience in the big data ecosystem, cloud technologies, with Hadoop (Pig, Hive, HDFS), Apache Spark, Java, R and NoSQL/SQL databases

4+ years of experience in business analytics and insights

Experience working in the Financial Services industry

Knowledge of deposit and investment products, payments and banking

Extensive experience connecting to and querying data from RBC data platforms and technologies EDW, Enterprise Data Lake (EDL)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-04-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-11-21-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Senior Lead, Strategic Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Lead, Strategic Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In the role of Senior Lead, Strategic Analytics, you will be responsible for evolving Mydoh\'s data landscape; and developing & enhancing business strategies to identify opportunities solutions to support growth and transformation.

You will identify, research, analyze, recommend, and execute solutions to drive an outstanding experience and strong business impact. You will lead and influence partners across Mydoh including Product, Marketing, Finance and Design. Your thought leadership will help shape the Mydoh business strategy and your implementation skills will bring the strategy to life.

What will you do?

  • Establish credibility by quickly acquiring and demonstrating subject matter expertise and deep knowledge in Mydoh
  • Drive future state reporting and Advanced Analytics to enable a fact base strategy utilizing internal and external data and insight
  • Drive insight from Mydoh data and competitive landscape in terms of what the data is telling up and what we need to do accordingly
  • Evolve Mydoh data landscape by implementing core data capabilities to enable private banking growth strategy leveraging modern data architecture and technologies
  • Strike a strong balance between driving market leading growth, creative client solutions and risk quality in line with established business appetite
  • Bring specific knowledge to bear, share subject matter experience and expertise, skills and knowledge, as well as non-proprietary work from other situations.
  • Lead and implement complex data projects of various scopes and types through problem identification, defining an approach, planning, organizing, and execution
  • Contribute to the unique culture of Mydoh by continually demonstrating commitment to coach and develop the team and grow the professional capabilities of the group and yourself

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

Notes:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function and strategy development (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting)
  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports
  • Experience communicating analytics results back to business partners and/or C-level: handling objections, proven experience on influencing driving data-driven strategy is a big plus.
  • Demonstrates innate curiosity and an ability to develop innovative solutions
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners, has proven experience of forming and managing these relationships, and is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback where and when needed

Nice-to-have

Notes:

  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a big plus.
  • Leadership experience and examples of leading initiatives without a title.
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

RBCX

VSANALYTICS

item.title: Developer - RAMPP Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - RAMPP Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Credit Trading desks at RBC are undergoing significant investment to modernize the calculation and speed of their existing trading platform.  Throughout 2022 and onwards we aim to move the business to a modern distributed pricing based framework, utilizing python, Kubernetes and docker for distribution.  You will work to build out a greenfield credit trading platform, building microservices for pricing, and working directly and closely with front office trading and quant teams.  The role will involve a lot of direct communication with front office users and will be based in RBC’s new London office at 100 Bishopsgate.

What will you do?

  • Work with our Front office and quant trading teams to understand their existing risk and pricing systems
  • Implement pricing and booking services in python
  • Develop high quality service-oriented REST endpoints
  • Work closely with a Front-End team to deliver a consolidated platform
  • Ensure the platform can perform effectively by utilising Kubernetes-based scaling technologies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Excellent python experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Knowledge of building enterprise-class applications at scale
  • Basic financial knowledge in any asset class
  • Good knowledge of enterprise-level concepts such as integration and regression testing

Nice-to-have

  • Experience building containerised applications
  • Derivatives knowledge

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Developer, XVA technology

London, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

United Kingdom

item.title: Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CBO Analytics & Reporting

Job Description

RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Business Intelligence is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence role that will lead strategic insights for CBO by utilizing cutting edge technologies to drive digital operations. The position plays a key role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders.

What will you do?

  • Drive the reduction of internal manual reports and processes either through automation or consolidation of existing reporting processes.
  • Provide adhoc requests and solutions as well as time sensitive break/fix requests to the satisfaction of our partners.
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to adhoc and break/fix solutions for future reference
  • Communicate and consult with partners across Canadian Banking Operations in order to provide support, insight, gather feedback, and communicate project statuses
  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand our business processes and objectives in order to define/recommend automating existing manual reporting solutions to meet those objectives
  • Be a thought partner within the Reporting COE team, supporting the development of insights, implementing best practices, and providing mentorship to team members


What do you need to succeed?


Must-have

  • Nimble with SQL for querying and joining large datasets and/or creating reports (e.g. MSSQL, Teradata, HDFS)
  • Demonstrated capabilities with Python or other automation technologies (e.g. Datameer)
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leadership in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Proven innovative mindset with quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently
  • A team player who is passionate about developing peers, winning as a team, and providing constructive feedback when needed


Nice-to-have

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., engineering, mathematics, statistics, etc.)
  • Proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Experience with technologies such as GitHub, Jira, general APIs
  • Project management capabilities


What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. The Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies, including providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

item.title: Marketing Analytics Manager, RBCx Ventures
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Marketing Analytics Manager, RBCx Ventures

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Manager of Marketing Analytics, you will be joining the Performance Marketing Centre of Excellence within RBCx to lead the creation and implementation of an ideal analytics framework, supporting several ventures in a startup culture, rich with fast-thinking and a quick-to-market mindset; and also working closely with our teams in Royal Bank of Canada, one of Canada’s largest banks.

The ideal candidate should have the interest and ability to take on highly advanced measurement implementations in a hands on fashion. You will work across our portfolio of mobile applications, mobile web applications, desktop web properties, and work within social platforms (e.g., Facebook) to ensure data is accurately captured and actioned appropriately within our marketing analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Appsflyer). With RBCx Ventures being a newer division of RBC, you have the opportunity to create and build upon a foundation that will shape the future growth of our businesses, and RBC.

What will you do?

  • Establish and implement proper marketing analytics standards and measurement plans analytical standards across multiple ventures/businesses to ensure all teams are set up for success when it comes to data collection and venture analysis.
  • Setup, maintain, and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties using Google Tag Manager and/or Javascript code
  • Provide technical support to internal and partner teams surrounding analytics tagging, data validation and data integration
  • Identify and implement all tagging requirements across both mobile app/web and desktop web properties
  • Assess and implement growth optimization tools such as Google Optimize, Unbounce and other A/B testing tools to improve & optimize on-site content
  • Guide and support key stakeholders in the appropriate implementation and validation of new tagging requirements and fixes, as well as ensuring existing tracking remains intact.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Readily sharable experience implementing analytical systems regardless of platform.
  • 3-5 years of digital analytics implementation or relevant experience
  • Experience with Tag Management tools such as Google Tag Manager, Segment, Tealium, others
  • Experience implementing web and advertising analytics tools such as Google Analytics 360, Appsflyer, Facebook Analytics, Google Optimize, Google Ads and others
  • Hands on experience coding in JavaScript events and jQuery as well as best practices for JavaScript coding
  • Paid advertising integrations i.e. App Conversion Events Integrations

Nice-to-have

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or an International equivalent

  • Familiarity with front end SPA frameworks such as Angular and React preferred Web application programming experience (PHP, Java, Ruby, etc.) preferred Debugging techniques and tools for front end web development

  • Project Tracking software experience (Asana, Jira)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. 

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

RBCx

VSMARKETING

Job Summary

Supports the development and maintenance of scalable data stores that supply big data in forms needed for business analysis. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Senior Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Senior Director, Consumer Portfolio Management and Analytics will report to the Vice President, Portfolio Management and Credit Strategy (PM&CS). The Senior Director will be responsible for driving a high level of employee engagement and performance, support sustainable value generation for RBC shareholders and acts as a thought leader on data and insight to support portfolio management with the ability to identify value added insight (reporting/dashboards/analysis), communicated in a consumable and easy to understand manner

What will you do?

  • Providing timely and highly accurate portfolio management reporting, dashboards and analysis to various stakeholder groups, including but not limited to the Portfolio Management Committee (PMC), Finance, the Chief Risk Officer and other Senior Executives, OSFI and other governmental parties, the Bank’s auditors, and RBC’s Investor Relations.  Ensure effective quality control processes and independent validations dependent on sensitivity and stakeholder type (eg. OSFI/IR = critically high; internal presentations = low/moderate)
  • Work with the PMCS modeling team to jointly deliver the CB Retail Stage 3 PCL planning, forecasting, and reporting
  • Ownership of the Downturn/Upturn playbook and governance process to ensure optimal and coordinated timing to retrench or accelerate credit dependent on where we are in the credit cycle
  • Monitor and communicate internal and external developments which may impact risk (e.g. regulatory changes, macro-economic factors. changes in the accumulation, usage and composition of consumer debt ,  issues arising from client or employee feedback, organizational restructure).
  • Develop early warning systems and reporting – providing a holistic view on consumer financial stress leveraging top down macro scenarios (ideally aligned with RBC Economics/IFRS9 inputs) and various bottom up client data types (delinquency, insolvencies, credit usage, deposits, flow of funds, etc).  Uncover and leverage additional client level data to drive a holistic client level view such as bridging retail and small business credit performance and leveraging wealth data where permissible, etc.  Undertake client level risk analysis (eg. climate impact to future PCL or balances at risk as well as Private Banking analytical risk support)
  • Represent PM&CS at strategic initiatives that impact retail credit as a whole.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through the analytics process to make sound information-based decisions and develop robust risk management measures to effectively identify, mitigate and monitor risks.
  • Lead OSFI “data calls” as required and ensure accurate and timely submissions
  • Lead the development of analytics that leverage the Retail Credit Transformation system. 
  • Impact and influence product design, pricing, policy, process, resource investment and future technology, with the ultimate goal of transforming the way RBC does business
  • Champion a positive and satisfying work climate by living and demonstrating RBC values.
  • Develop and manage relationships with key executives across the credit value chain and product leaders to ensure collaboration in the awareness of key risk metrics, performance and analytical requirements.
  • Attract, develop and manage a team of highly-specialized analysts.
  • Foster an environment that encourages employee engagement by building a dynamic and balanced structure, delegating the necessary authority and accountability to maximize efficiency and achieve outstanding performance and act as OneRBC.
  • Drive the development of current and future leaders: ensure succession plans are in place to maintain the continuity of strong leadership required for long-term success and contribution.
  • Educate stakeholders on risk management approach and risk analysis methodology.
  • Add value through providing guidance and sharing expertise

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Minimum of 5 years credit portfolio management experience combined with credit scoring or risk modeling background.
  • In depth credit risk experience – preferably retail strategy, modeling, forecasting, and/or reporting and analysis
  • Strong strategic, analytical and business mindset (MBA, MA Analytics, MA Economics, MA Statistics, etc)
  • Passion and experience in reporting, dashboards, and analysis and translating complex trending into easily consumable insights
  • Proven effective leadership and internal/external senior stakeholder experience
  • Technical ability to drive automation and visualization
  • Proven ability to deal with compressed hard timelines

Nice-to-Have:

  • Previous expected credit loss program development experience
  • Experience with regulatory project management

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Manages a Global Risk Monitoring/Reporting and Risk Operations team to develop and implement risk management reports, systems, and processes. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-02-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-11-06-07:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Associate Director, Wholesale Capital Measurement & Analytics, FRO
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Wholesale Capital Measurement & Analytics, FRO

Job Description

  • Responsible for calculating regulatory capital requirements for RBC’s wholesale portfolios (under Basel III/IRB and Basel II/STD Floor) in compliance with OSFI CAR guidelines, internal policies and other mandated protocols. Including maintenance of robust processes, policies and procedures to ensure accuracy of capital calculations
  • Develop and enhance capital measurement validation approaches along with supporting the execution of challenges related to capital measurement and management processes, including forecasting methodologies, assumptions/inputs, governance, results, and business decisions
  • Play an important role in production and submission of critical internal and external disclosers and regulatory filings such as RBC’s Basel Capital Adequacy Requirements (BCAR) reporting to OSFI, Pillar 3, NCR, etc. while ensuring ongoing integrity of capital calculation and reporting processes
  • Develop extensive knowledge of the capital data domain, lineages and controls to enable development of better capital review and analytical tools
  • Define, develop, and continuously enhance attribution and other analytics that can effectively demonstrate exposure, EAD and RWA calculations. This analysis will include variance analysis period over period are explained (with attribution to exposure and risk factor changes) in a reliable and transparent manner
  • Provide analytical and domain advisory on advanced and complex regulatory capital calculations and risk methodologies. Including supporting business teams across the organization to better understand and optimize drivers of credit risk capital specific to their portfolios
  • Collaborate with stakeholders including line of business, risk, finance, IT, and data teams to ensure accuracy of capital measurement calculations. Also provide thought leadership and requirements for analytics that further enhances transparency to the overall RWA calculations and reporting process.
  • Work with various stakeholders such as GRM credit adjudication, Parameter Estimation, and Stress testing teams to successfully implement wholesale credit risk models and parameters as per OSFI and Basel prescribed regulatory guidelines.
  • Identify and drive execution of RWA optimization opportunities by collaborating with business partners including line of business, risk, legal and finance teams to ensure capital charges are calculated and optimized per approved policies, guidelines and applicable regulatory framework
  • Develop and provide value-added analysis including scenario and sensitivity analysis to drive effective and optimized capital measurement specific to various aspects of RBC’s wholesale portfolio. Also, provide portfolio specific impacts/views to drive senior management decision making.
  • Participate in Quantitative Impact Studies (QIS) of proposed regulatory framework changes, effectively communicating the impacts and helping business stakeholders formulate strategies to transition to new requirements, and working with IT teams to implement changes to complex capital system architecture.  
  • Participate in capital measurement and reporting reviews conducted by control functions such as audit, SOX office, risk management etc. Provide the necessary subject matter expertise and evidences to demonstrate robustness and accuracy of RWA calculation and reporting processes
  • Manage and address RWA reviews by other control functions such as Internal Audit, Independent Compliance Risk Management, Capital Planning Review Group etc. and feedback if any, are remediated in an appropriate and timely manner
  • Identify potential process improvements and capabilities to increase consistency, transparency, and reliability of RWA calculation, governance and controls processes
  • Provide detailed/technical analysis of the impact of new or changing regulations and develop options for potential advocacy work with external stakeholders such CBA, OSFI, BCBS, etc
  • Play a key role in the rollout and stabilization of FRO’s new capital measurement tool (Axiom) by providing hands on subject matter advisory across complex topics related to measurement, reporting, and analytics
  • Act as an important resource in interpretation of new Basel IV CAR, Pillar 3, and NCR guidelines and effectively translating them into specific business and technical requirements for various IT and Vendor resources to work on
  • Provide subject matter expertise in helping IT and vendor resources to build sound business requirements, data analysis & mapping, business rules specification, and use cases development to ensure delivery of robust solutions to fulfill changing Basel regulatory requirements, audit concerns, business goal of capital optimization and credit risk capital analysis
  • Contribute towards defining and scoping use cases spanning various aspects related to capital measurement for wholesale products under BIV rules.  Done to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with pertinent policies, procedures, methodologies, and regulatory guidelines

Must-Have

  • Advanced academic qualification in fields of financial or risk management.
  • Deep understanding of banking products and application of pertinent regulatory capital rules (OSFI CAR & Basel guidelines) to exposure emanating from these products.
  • Deep understanding capital measurement and common capital attribution approaches.
  • Appreciation of concepts relating to consolidated and solo capital measurement
  • Authoritative leader capable of guiding solutions working in collaboration with cross-functional teams
  • Ability to think strategically and connect analysis to solutions and objectives
  • Ability to write and present succinct solutions 

Nice to Have

  • A professional accounting designation or a MBA with concentration in Finance
  • Good understanding of risk management & measurement approaches and common practices in a financial services context
  • Extensive experience in managing multiple views of capital in a large, multi-dimensional financial services institution
  • Up-to-date and understanding of concepts relating to Basel IV and leverage measurement along with experience in assessing the impacts of these on trading portfolios
  • Familiarity with OSFI advanced model approval process.

Job Summary

This is a subject matter role within the Capital Measurement team part Financial Resource Optimization (FRO) team.

In this role, the incumbent will be responsible for driving capital measurement related activities for RBC’s wholesale portfolios and supporting preparation of various RBC disclosures such RBC’s Basel Capital Adequacy Requirements (BCAR) reporting to OSFI, Pillar 3, NCR, etc. In addition to that, the incumbent will play a key role in driving and eventual implementation of some of the very complex and critical deliverables as part of FRO’s Axiom project and BIV implementation.

To effectively serve the mandate, the role will liaise and collaborate with key stakeholders across the Bank, including business, risk and finance teams, regulators, and Technology groups.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Office of the CFO

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-08-09-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-12-06-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Senior Product and Analytics Manager, Point of Sale Lending
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Product and Analytics Manager, Point of Sale Lending

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

PayPlan by RBC is RBC’s new digital lending solution for e-commerce and in-store purchases. PayPlan by RBC offers consumers a transparent and convenient way to pay-over-time (or more popularly referenced as buy now pay later) for big-ticket purchases at participating retailers and merchants throughout Canada.

As the Senior Product and Analytics Manager, Point of Sale Lending, you will be an integral part of the PayPlan product team. You will be responsible for building and executing the Point of Sale Lending product strategy/roadmap, while also identifying emerging opportunities and trends to support the development of innovative products, services, and functionality. You will own the P&L and dive deep into every element to find opportunities to optimize our product and our business and deliver against them.

What will you do?

  • Work closely with the project team both internally and externally to build, report, and optimize against PayPlan by RBC’s overall P&L. Responsible for P&L Planning, setting growth objectives and managing key revenue drivers.
  • Lead new product launches with key partners as our major pay over time programs including with Microsoft, Apple, and SMBs continue to expand
  • Responsible for product management, including strategy, forecasting, product features and value proposition, promotion, pricing and process enhancements for revenue and profitability optimization.
  • Leverage holistic business acumen to drive us towards a profitable and scalable business model
  • Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to determine new features and prioritization of features for us to deliver against our business objectives
  • Build and maintain vendor relationships across 3 primary vendors and merchants to ensure delivery of objectives on time and on target
  • Lead executive level discussions to provide updates on overall business, and conduct deep dive analysis and share results and strategic recommendations at this level for alignment
  • Conduct voice of the customer research to ensure product is performing with customers as expected and uncover insights / feature optimizations to build into long term roadmap
  • Assume responsibility for the product features and user experience for any launches or implementations you lead
  • Implement the strategy on behalf of business and deliver a measurable impact on shareholder value via increased revenue, client satisfaction, RBC brand development and reduced cost to serve
  • Contribute to the product strategy to implement overall Point of Sale Lending strategy

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strategy & Analytics experience diving into complex business models and presenting & implementing recommendations successfully
  • Product Management experience leading, development of small digital products and/or enhancements
  • Experience with financial forecasting and interpreting trending analysis.
  • Comfort and desire to work on an agile team with constantly changing priorities
  • Desire and willingness to roll up your sleeves to get whatever needs to get done done. Not all days in this role are glamourous but we are a small and nimble team who all help each other!
  • Deep expertise in one or more technical area(s) including architecture, quality assurance and development
  • Strong prioritization skills
  • Undergraduate degree

Nice-to-have

  • 7-10 years relevant experience
  • Previous experience consulting considered an asset

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, fair compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who help your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-09-21-07:00

Application Deadline:

2022-11-28-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
